abstract: Brian T. Moynihan, chief of Bank of America, must offer a bold plan or face the ire of already frustrated investors.
snippet: Brian T. Moynihan, chief of Bank of America, must offer a bold plan or face the ire of already frustrated investors.
lead_paragraph: Like a magician facing a weary audience, Bank of America faces pressure to pull another rabbit out of its hat.

headline.main: Bank Chief Has Big Job to Reassure Stockholders
headline.print_headline: Bank Chief Has Big Job To Reassure Stockholders

abstract: At a financial conference held by Barclays, Brian T. Moynihan, the chief executive of Bank of America, addressed problems faced by the bank and unveiled elements of “Project New BAC.”  We live-blogged his speech.
snippet: At a financial conference held by Barclays, Brian T. Moynihan, the chief executive of Bank of America, addressed problems faced by the bank and unveiled elements of “Project New BAC.”  We live-blogged his speech.
lead_paragraph: It’s time for Brian T. Moynihan’s close-up.

headline.main: Live Blog: Moynihan Speaks on Bank of America’s Future

abstract: William T. Winters, a former co-head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank, and Martin Taylor, a former chief executive of Barclays, said they had “no sympathy” for bankers arguing that the new rules would damage Britain’s economy and banking sector.
snippet: William T. Winters, a former co-head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank, and Martin Taylor, a former chief executive of Barclays, said they had “no sympathy” for bankers arguing that the new rules would damage Britain’s economy and banking sector...
lead_paragraph: Two former bankers defended the new industry changes proposed on Monday by a British panel, lashing out against one-time colleagues.

headline.main: Two Former Bankers Defend British Reform Plan

abstract: The announcement came after a presentation by the bank’s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
snippet: The announcement came after a presentation by the bank’s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America said in a statement released on Monday that it planned to eliminate 30,000 jobs “over the next few years.”

headline.main: Bank of America Confirms Plans to Eliminate 30,000 Jobs

abstract: About 30,000 jobs will be eliminated over the next few years as part of $5 billion in cuts planned by the chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
snippet: About 30,000 jobs will be eliminated over the next few years as part of $5 billion in cuts planned by the chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America’s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, vowed on Monday to eliminate $5 billion in costs annually by 2014, including by cutting at least 30,000 jobs at the company.

headline.main: Bank of America Confirms Plan to Cut 30,000 Positions
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Confirms Plan to Cut 30,000 Positions
